OVERVIEW: The Inkosr series consists of very deep, poorly drained soils on bottomlands.  These soils formed in alluvium derived dominantly from basic igneous rock.  Slope is 0 to 2 percent.  The mean annual rainfall is about 177 inches, and the mean annual temperature is about 81 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine, mixed, semiactive, nonacid, isohyperthermic Typic Endoaquepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Inkosr silty clay loam - swamp forest.  When described (2/3/80) the soil was moist to a depth of 10 inches and saturated below.  (Colors are for moist soil.  All textures are apparent field textures.)
A1--0 to 7 inches; dark yellowish brown (10YR 3/4) silty clay loam; strong fine subangular blocky structure; friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; many fine and medium roots; common fine tubular and interstitial pores; medium acid (pH 6.0, 1:1 water); abrupt smooth boundary.  (4 to 10 inches thick)
B1--7 to 11 inches; dark brown (10YR 3/3) silty clay loam; many medium distinct strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) mottles; strong fine subangular blocky structure; friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common fine and medium roots; common fine tubular pores; medium acid (pH 6.0, 1:1 water); clear smooth boundary..  (3 to 6 inches thick)
B2--11 to 18 inches; dark gray (10YR 4/1) silty clay loam; many medium distinct yellowish red (5YR 5/8) mottles; moderate fine and medium subangular blocky structure; friable, sticky and slightly plastic; few fine and medium roots; common fine tubular pores; medium acid (pH 6.0, 1:1 water); clear wavy boundary.  (5 to 8 inches thick)
C1g--18 to 29 inches;  dark greenish gray (5GY 4/1) silty clay loam; massive; sticky and slightly plastic; common fine tubular pores; slightly acid (pH 6.5, 1:1 water); gradual wavy boundary.  (8 to 39 inches thick)
C2g--29 to 59 inches; dark greenish gray (5G 4/1) silty clay loam; massive; sticky and slightly plastic; common fine tubular pores; about 10 percent hard rounded basalt pebbles; slightly acid (pH 6.5, 1:1 water).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Island of Kosrae, Federated States of Micronesia; about 984 feet north of the high school boundary in Tofol and 33 feet west of the main road; lat. 5 degrees 19 minutes 47 seconds N. and long. 163 degrees 0 minute 28 seconds E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Depth to the fluctuating water table ranges from 6 to 23 inches, depth to the gleyed C horizon ranges from 12 to 23 inches.  The profile is strongly acid or medium acid.
The A horizon has moist color of 10YR 2/2, 3/2, 3/3, or 3/4.  It is silty clay loam or sandy clay loam and has 0 to 30 percent pebbles.
The upper part of the B horizon has moist color of 10YR 3/3 or 4/3 and has mottles of 7.5YR 4/6, 5/6, or 5/8.  The lower part has moist color of 10YR 4/1 or 4/2 and has mottles of 5YR 5/6 or 5/8, or of 7.5YR 4/6 or 5/8.  It is sandy clay loam, clay loam, or silty clay loam and has 0 to 30 percent pebbles.
The C horizon has moist color of 5G 4/1, of 5GY 4/1, or of 5Y 5/2.  It is silty clay loam, clay loam, silty clay, or clay and has 0 to 30 percent pebbles.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Insak and Nansepsep series.  Insak soils are sandy.  Nansepsep soils are somewhat poorly drained.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Inkosr soils are on bottomlands.  They formed in alluvium derived dominantly from basic igneous rock.  Slopes are 0 to 2 percent.  Elevation is 3 to 49 feet.  The mean annual rainfall is about 157 to 196 inches, and the mean annual temperature is about 81 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Ngerungor and the competing Nansepsep soils.  Ngerungor soils are organic and very poorly drained.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Poorly drained; slow runoff; moderate permeability.  The soils are flooded occasionally for very brief periods in any month.  The water table is at a depth of 6 to 23 inches throughout the year.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Inkosr soils are generally  left idle, but in some areas they are used to grow wetland taro or rice.  In areas not cultivated, the vegetation is swamp forest or freshwater marsh.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  On the islands of Kosrae and Ponape, East Caroline Islands.  The series is of small extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Davis, California

ORIGIN.content:
SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Kosrae, Federated States of Micronesia, 1981.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
